title: Typophile back after maintenance
content:
New things I have noticed:

- an additional ‘cms’ in the URL (old URLs still work) – why?
- most of the embedded and attached files (images, PDFs) within threads are missing – a temporary issue?

Known issues that haven’t changed:

- Search still unusable
- long threads are [paged](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/typophile.com/node/53932) (after 90 replies – that’s reasonable), but [unread replies aren’t marked on following pages](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/typophile.com/node/19295#comment-118510)

Older threads with suggestions and wishes:  
 [Typophile “To Do” 2007](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/typophile.com/node/29729)  
 [Typophile Bugs and Suggestions](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/typophile.com/node/34693)  
 [Typophile Beta Bug Report (deprecated)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/typophile.com/node/12063)

[http://www.typophile.com/feedback](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804010418/http:/www.typophile.com/feedback "http://www.typophile.com/feedback")
author: Florian Hardwig

comments.content:
Florian,

Images and files may appear missing because the site is still caching. This could take up to a full day or more.

This maintenance was not for fixing bugs or addressing feature issues - and yes we are aware of the problems you listed above and are working towards solutions. We were simply upgrading to a faster server - which was supposed to take 30 minutes but our lovely friends at MediaTemple decided it should take much, much longer.

Thanks

Zara,  
thanks for your reply!

Yes, maybe the – perceived, not really – long downtime raised false expectations.  
;-)  
Good to know that the missing images will reappear.  
And a faster server? That’s great news! Thanks,  
F

What's with messing with the URL structure? It appears that the /cms/ thing is perhaps a staging area? I hope so, because if you thought that your Google indexing was bad before, wait until your entire site is de-indexed. Automated 302 redirects are helpful, and if the move is permanent, full 301 redirects are essential.

As a side note, if the /cms/ change isn't a staging area for the server transfers, it's a poor URL design structure that does little to help the end user. A URL re-write could be used to make things more user, and SEO, friendly.

Just some thoughts, in any case. Take them for what you will.
